title: Cybersecurity Notes
description: My three level cybersecurity course that takes learners from basic online safety to professional risk and security practice, using interactive tools and everyday examples.

levels.title: Cybersecurity Foundations
levels.label: Foundations
levels.summary: Friendly on-ramp for data, networks, passwords, phishing and everyday defences using in-browser labs.
learning_outcomes: Explain what data is, how bits and bytes work and how text is encoded.
Describe at a high level how data moves across a network in packets.
Define confidentiality, integrity and availability in plain language.
Recognise simple everyday attacks such as weak passwords and phishing.

levels.title: Applied Cybersecurity
levels.label: Applied
levels.summary: Think like attackers and defenders with threat modelling, web auth flows, common vulns, logs, and risk trade-offs.
learning_outcomes: Draw a simple threat model for a small system and talk through likely threats.
Explain attack surface and link common vulnerability types to broken assumptions.
Describe how authentication, sessions and access control work in a web style system.
Interpret simple logs and talk about basic risk trade offs in practice.

levels.title: Cybersecurity Practice and Strategy
levels.label: Practice & Strategy
levels.summary: Join up governance, secure design, DevSecOps, CVEs, incident response and business-focused risk thinking.
learning_outcomes: Relate real systems work to major frameworks such as NIST CSF and Cyber Essentials in plain language.
Design simple defence in depth control stacks for common scenarios.
Walk through a basic incident story from preparation to learning.
Explain governance, culture and long term digital risk to non technical stakeholders.
